title: AWS Security to Azure Security: Shared Responsibility and Compliance Fundamentals
description: Master foundational cloud security concepts by understanding AWS shared responsibility model and migrating to Azure security fundamentals with compliance frameworks, access controls, and core security best practices.
learningObjectives: Understand AWS shared responsibility model and Azure shared responsibility
Learn core AWS security services and their Azure equivalents
Explore identity and access management fundamentals
Understand encryption, data protection, and privacy concepts
Learn compliance frameworks and security best practices
Compare AWS and Azure security monitoring and incident response
prerequisites: Completion of CLF-C02 Cloud Concepts Lab
Basic understanding of IT security concepts
Familiarity with user accounts and permissions
businessScenario: SecureFinance Corp is a financial services company that handles sensitive customer data and must comply with strict regulatory requirements including PCI DSS, SOX, and regional data protection laws. They're planning to migrate from AWS to Azure and need to understand cloud security fundamentals, shared responsibility models, and how to maintain their security posture and compliance during and after migration.

sections.title: Shared Responsibility Model Fundamentals
topics: Customer responsibilities vs cloud provider responsibilities
Security 'of' the cloud vs security 'in' the cloud

tasks.title: Map Shared Responsibility Models
tasks.description: Understand and compare AWS and Azure shared responsibility frameworks
steps: Study AWS shared responsibility model for different service types
Compare with Azure shared responsibility model components
Identify customer responsibilities for compute, storage, and networking
Map cloud provider responsibilities for infrastructure and services
Understand shared controls and compliance implications
Create responsibility matrix for common scenarios

sections.title: Identity and Access Management Foundations
topics: AWS IAM fundamentals: users, groups, roles, policies
Azure Active Directory basics and identity concepts
Principle of least privilege and access controls

tasks.title: Design Basic Identity Architecture
tasks.description: Create foundational identity and access management design
steps: Design AWS IAM structure with users, groups, and roles
Compare with Azure AD tenant and identity organization
Implement principle of least privilege access policies
Configure multi-factor authentication requirements
Design role-based access control (RBAC) hierarchy
Plan identity federation and single sign-on approach

sections.title: Data Protection and Encryption
topics: AWS KMS and encryption key management
Azure Key Vault and cryptographic services
Encryption at rest and in transit concepts

tasks.title: Implement Data Protection Strategy
tasks.description: Design comprehensive data protection and encryption approach
steps: Plan AWS KMS key management and encryption strategy
Compare with Azure Key Vault cryptographic services
Implement encryption at rest for storage services
Configure encryption in transit for data communication
Design data classification and labeling framework
Address data sovereignty and privacy requirements

sections.title: Security Monitoring and Compliance
topics: Azure Monitor and Activity Log for security events

tasks.title: Setup Security Monitoring Framework
tasks.description: Establish basic security monitoring and compliance tracking
steps: Configure AWS CloudTrail for comprehensive logging
Set up Azure Activity Log and security event monitoring
Implement AWS Config rules for compliance checking
Create Azure Policy definitions for governance automation
Design incident detection and alerting workflows
Plan compliance reporting and audit preparation

hands-onExercises.title: Shared Responsibility Assessment Exercise
hands-onExercises.description: Conduct shared responsibility assessment for a sample workload
steps: Review provided sample web application architecture
Identify all components: compute, storage, networking, applications
Map AWS shared responsibility for each component
Compare with Azure shared responsibility model
Document customer security responsibilities
Create security implementation checklist
hands-onExercises.expectedOutcome: Complete shared responsibility assessment with clear customer action items

hands-onExercises.title: Basic IAM Policy Design Challenge
hands-onExercises.description: Design access control policies for different user roles
steps: Define three user roles: developer, admin, read-only analyst
Create AWS IAM policies for each role with appropriate permissions
Design equivalent Azure AD roles and access assignments
Implement principle of least privilege for all roles
Add MFA requirements and conditional access policies
Test and validate policy effectiveness
hands-onExercises.expectedOutcome: Functional IAM policies demonstrating proper access control design

hands-onExercises.title: Security Compliance Checklist Creation
hands-onExercises.description: Build security compliance checklist for common frameworks
steps: Research PCI DSS, SOC 2, and ISO 27001 requirements
Map requirements to AWS and Azure security controls
Create implementation checklist for each framework
Identify automated compliance monitoring opportunities
Design evidence collection and reporting processes
Plan continuous compliance validation approach
hands-onExercises.expectedOutcome: Comprehensive compliance checklist with implementation guidance

troubleshooting.issue: Confusion about customer vs provider security responsibilities
troubleshooting.solution: Use specific examples and scenarios, provide clear visual diagrams, and emphasize 'if you can see/configure it, you're responsible for securing it'

troubleshooting.issue: Overwhelming number of security services and concepts
troubleshooting.solution: Start with core concepts (identity, encryption, monitoring), use progressive disclosure, and provide practical examples for each service
Focus on common frameworks, provide business context for compliance needs, and use industry-specific examples

criteria: Can clearly explain customer vs provider responsibilities
Understands responsibility differences across service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS)
Can apply shared responsibility model to real-world scenarios
Understands IAM concepts: users, groups, roles, policies
Can design basic access control frameworks
Knows how to implement principle of least privilege
Understands MFA and authentication best practices
Understands encryption at rest and in transit concepts
Can explain key management best practices
Knows data classification and protection strategies
Demonstrates awareness of privacy and sovereignty requirements
Can design basic compliance monitoring approach
Knows incident detection and response fundamentals
Demonstrates awareness of common compliance frameworks

coverage: Understand the AWS shared responsibility model
Understand AWS Cloud security, governance, and compliance concepts
Identify components and resources for security
examTopics: Shared responsibility model for security and compliance
AWS security services and identity management

successMetrics: Can explain shared responsibility model for different scenarios
Demonstrates understanding of core identity and access management
Shows knowledge of data protection and encryption fundamentals
Can design basic security monitoring and compliance approaches
Understands security best practices for cloud migration
nextSteps: Proceed to CLF-C02 Cloud Technology and Services Lab (34% domain)
Begin hands-on practice with AWS IAM and Azure AD
Explore specific security services in both cloud platforms
Study compliance frameworks relevant to your industry
